channel.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
channel.description:
Hi there,
It’s been a while since I’ve published something new, so here it is: https://soundcloud.com/yaneeck/le-feu
As always, I hope you’ll like it :slight_smile:
Have a nice day, Tomasz

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: yaneeck
item.description:
I like it! It’s really good: analog sound, arpeggios, catchy rhythms. It sounds a bit like Ulver’s last album.

Read full topic

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
For sure. Just wanted to make sure the takeaway was understood as Auxy-specific rather than a hard rule for absolutely all occasions.

 
It’s also why I qualify / caveat statements with things like…

…if not overdone.

Read full topic

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
You’re right about it being different for different systems.

A club or festival sound system wouldn’t be able to take bass panning, but small things like headphones, earphones will.
But, the sickness comes from hearing any bass being panned.
Whether it be on a Funktion One, or Apple EarPods.

And, I know what you may be thinking:
“I didn’t feel sick when I heard it.”
You may not have felt sick, but your ears where getting tired of it. It causes rapid ear fatigue.
And, the last thing you’d want listeners to do is get tired of your music.

About the “bass vs sub” thing:
You’re right.
But…
It’s not possible to isolate mono the sub from the bass in Auxy.
In Ableton, you can isolate mono sub, which is great!
But, with Auxy, your sub is stuck with your bass.
So, it’s probably best to keep your bass (and sub) in the middle.

Read full topic

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
It’s pretty good stuff, in my opinion. It’s like picturing all the really awesome, classic synth music artists having a moody goth cousin lol.

Give this a taste if curious. Intro is a little long but this is such a classic!

https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ci_LIavsEhQ

Anyway sorry for derailing a bit, Tomasz as always great job and looking forward to the next!

EDIT: Original link was not album version, was super long and had a weird cartoon Matrix video?! Lol…

Read full topic

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
That would depend on where you intend to play it, no?

If it’s a club mix (literally intended for playing in a club), then yes, bass in the middle for the reasons you mentioned - plus you want to create an even listening experience wherever someone is in relation to the nearest speakers.

But, if it’s a home / headphone / stereo mix, then some stereo panning on the bass might be fine, if that’s the effect you’re going for. I can imagine something like swirling Neuro Bass would work well with some slight panning automation in a full stereo mix - if not overdone.

(Imo, it’s also worth not conflating ‘bass’ with ‘sub’. Each can - and probably should - be treated/mixed separately and differently.)

Read full topic

item.description:
Hi Darren
Thanks for your kind words. As far as the “hold” is concerned, I experiment as always and my projects are a mess, so I don’t even know if it’s ok to hold music for so long. I don’t follow any rules except one: it must sound well

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Bass is the “base” of the track.
It’s the foundation.
You can’t have a wobbly foundation.

Plus, it makes subwoofers shake, and people get sick. (Those things are not jokes. Bass that isn’t straight makes people sick, and sound systems not sound good. )

Read full topic

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Did you pan the bass?

Bass shouldn’t be panned. It should be straight in the middle.

item.title: Le Feu (Fire) by YANEECK
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Love it. Classic synth goodness, it’s not always my bag but you always do it in a way that hooks into my ear!

I kind of want to start a side side project lol. Cause there’s ONE genre I still haven’t heard anyone do here, and I do think Auxy is capable especially now having an expanded drum palette.

Read full topic
